text: guys today I'm gonna share a recipe with
you that only has four ingredients but
it's gonna be one of the most satisfying
meals that you make all year it's a
braised pork in a salsa verde and the
trick is that the salsa is store-bought
and it's pretty fantastic you use a cup
of green salsa as part of the sauce for
this pork you just need to slice 1 onion
3 pounds of pork shoulder it's cut into
1-inch pieces all you need to do is
season with some salt and pepper a
little toss all I recommend is that if
you're using a store-bought salsa make
sure you use one that you love so taste
a few make sure you get one that you
like and then all of your dishes that
you cook with salsa will be delicious
put it straight into a big pot no
browning needed for this recipe either
add your onion this is ridiculously easy
you guys are gonna be making this
constantly this is one cup of green
salsa it's a tomatillo salsa you can
make your own we have recipes on Martha
Stewart comm if you want one or you can
buy it like I said it does make it much
easier if you're using store-bought one
and a half cups of chicken broth that's
it bring it to a boil reduce it to a
simmer and cook it until the pork is
very very tender that should take about
an hour and a half when it's done all
you need is a little bit of lime and
some cilantro I for one I'm super duper
excited to eat this I know that most
people would look at this and think
dinner but I look at this and I think
what an amazing practice fry an egg and
put it on top of this holy Kamali that
would be fantastic
serve it with maybe some tortillas if
you want to and some cilantro little
squeeze of lime it is done
it's incredible give it a try
